thread.title: Shadow Cabinet Minister says restoring whip to Anne Marie Morris shows 'Tories are still the nasty party'

author: Daniel Clark
title: Shadow Cabinet Minister says restoring whip to Anne Marie Morris shows 'Tories are still the nasty party'
text:
News Shadow Cabinet Minister says restoring whip to Anne Marie Morris shows 'Tories are still the nasty party' Anne Marie Morris is the MP for Newton Abbot and was suspended after she described the UK leaving the EU without a deal as a “real n r in the woodpile” Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get Daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A Labour shadow minister has said it is a disgrace and shows that the Conservatives are still the 'nasty party' after Anne Marie Morris had the party whip restored to her. 
Ms Morris, who has been the MP for Newton Abbot since 2010, described the UK leaving the EU without a deal as a “real n r in the woodpile” at the launch of a report into the future for the UK’s financial sector after Brexit. Anne Marie Morris MP 
She apologised for the remarks, saying: “The comment was unintentional and I apologise unreservedly for any offence caused.” 
She was suspended from the Conservative Party as a result of the remarks, but on Tuesday, she had the Whip restored to her. Read More Devon Conservative MP Anne Marie Morris has whip restored after 'n r in the woodpile' comment 
Ms Morris said: “ I would like to take this opportunity to apologise again for using such inappropriate and offensive language. The whip has been returned to me today. I feel proud and privileged to be a Conservative Member of Parliament and I will continue to serve my community and my country to the best of my ability.” Anne Marie Morris MP 
Shadow Cabinet Office minister Jon Trickett, who is the MP for Hemsworth, though said: "It's a disgrace that the so-called 'caring' Conservatives have welcomed back Anne Marie Morris, who made an appallingly racist comment. 
"It appears the prime minister is so weak and desperate to avoid a Parliamentary Brexit defeat she is prepared to forgive and forget racism. Read More 
"Theresa May once branded the Conservatives the 'nasty party' and it is clear nothing has changed." Like us on Facebook
